com.cmput301f20t14.bookbox.activities

Class HomeActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, androidx.activity.OnBackPressedDispatcherOwner, androidx.appcompat.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, androidx.core.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, androidx.core.view.KeyEventDispatcher.Component, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner

    public class HomeActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
    This shows the Home Menu with a task bar at the bottom The Home Menu shows the users owned books By navigating the task bar, the user can: - View their profile - View their notifications - View their Library (Home Menu) - View a menu where they can choose to view requests & borrowed books
    See Also:
    NotificationsActivity, ProfileActivity, ListsActivity

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void bottomNavigationView()
      Implementation of the bottom navigation bar for switching to different activity views, such as home, profile, notifications and lists References: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JjfSjMs0ImQ&feature=youtu.be
      private void firebaseInitBookListener()
      This initializes a SnapShotListener to Firebase so the list of books owned by the user is always correct
      Book getBookFromDbData(com.google.firebase.firestore.QueryDocumentSnapshot queryDoc)
      Initializes a Book object from the data in a QueryDocumentSnapshot object
      void getOwnedBooks(com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference booksCollectionRef)
      This method gets the owned books from the database and adds it to the ListView
      void launchViewing(Book book)
      This method launches the EditBookActivity to allow the user to view the description of a book selected from the list of owned books through clicking or through scanning the ISBN
      protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode, int resultCode, android.content.Intent data)
      Implements functionality when a previously launched activity is finished with a potential set result.
      protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState) 
      void searchBookInDb(java.lang.String barcode)
      This method launches the EditBookActivity after the ISBN of a book is successfully scanned through the ScanningActivity
      void setUpAddBookButton()
      Setting up the onClick listener for the scanning button Listener launches the AddBook activity to allow the user to add a new book to his or her collection of books
      void setUpFilter()
      This method sets up the OnItemSelected listener and modifies the list of owned books displayed depending on the status selected by the user
      private void setUpItemClickListener()
      Setting up the onItemClickListener for the ListView representing the owned books of the user.
      private void setUpScanningButton()
      Setting up the onClick listener for the scanning button Listener launches the Scanning activity to obtain a book description by scanning the ISBN
      private void setUpSearchingButton()
      Setting up the onClick listener for the search button Listener launches the search activity to find available books based on if a keyword is in the book description

      • getOwnedBooks

        public void getOwnedBooks(com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference booksCollectionRef)
        This method gets the owned books from the database and adds it to the ListView
        Parameters:
        booksCollectionRef - Reference to the books collection

      • getBookFromDbData

        public Book getBookFromDbData(com.google.firebase.firestore.QueryDocumentSnapshot queryDoc)
        Initializes a Book object from the data in a QueryDocumentSnapshot object
        Parameters:
        queryDoc - QueryDocumentSnapshot object obtained after database query
        Returns:
        Book object initialized from data in queryDoc

      • launchViewing

        public void launchViewing(Book book)
        This method launches the EditBookActivity to allow the user to view the description of a book selected from the list of owned books through clicking or through scanning the ISBN
        Parameters:
        book - The book whose description will be viewed

      • setUpFilter

        public void setUpFilter()
        This method sets up the OnItemSelected listener and modifies the list of owned books displayed depending on the status selected by the user

      • setUpItemClickListener

        private void setUpItemClickListener()
        Setting up the onItemClickListener for the ListView representing the owned books of the user. On clicking an item, the EditBookActivity is started.

      • setUpSearchingButton

        private void setUpSearchingButton()
        Setting up the onClick listener for the search button Listener launches the search activity to find available books based on if a keyword is in the book description

      • setUpScanningButton

        private void setUpScanningButton()
        Setting up the onClick listener for the scanning button Listener launches the Scanning activity to obtain a book description by scanning the ISBN

      • setUpAddBookButton

        public void setUpAddBookButton()
        Setting up the onClick listener for the scanning button Listener launches the AddBook activity to allow the user to add a new book to his or her collection of books

      • searchBookInDb

        public void searchBookInDb(java.lang.String barcode)
        This method launches the EditBookActivity after the ISBN of a book is successfully scanned through the ScanningActivity
        Parameters:
        barcode - A string representing the scanned isbn of a book
